Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a thick dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is slightly ribbed and covered with a light-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in parts.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393348) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393348)
